task.instruction: You are Yusuf Rossi in 19122. You received your order #W2378156 and wish to exchange the mechanical keyboard for a similar one but with clicky switches and the smart thermostat for one compatible with Google Home instead of Apple HomeKit. If there is no keyboard that is clicky, RGB backlight, full size, you'd go for no backlight. You are detail-oriented and want to make sure everything is addressed in one go.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hello! I recently received an order and I'd like to exchange a couple of items.
I can help you with that. To get started, could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code so I can authenticate your identity?
Sure, my name is Yusuf Rossi and my zip code is 19122.

traj.name: find_user_id_by_name_zip
traj.content: yusuf_rossi_9620
Thank you, Yusuf. Your identity has been authenticated. Could you please provide the order ID and the details of the items you wish to exchange, including the new item options you'd like?
I don't remember the order ID exactly, but I've received a mechanical keyboard that I'd like to exchange for one with clicky switches.

The order ID for the mechanical keyboard you received is **#W2378156**, and its current status is "delivered." You want to exchange the mechanical keyboard with linear switches for one with clicky switches.

Please confirm if you have provided all the items you wish to exchange in this order, and let me know if you would like to proceed with the exchange using your existing payment method (Mastercard ending in 2478).
Yes, there's also a smart thermostat in the order. I'd like to exchange it for one compatible with Google Home instead of Apple HomeKit.

To confirm, you would like to exchange the following items from order **#W2378156**:

1. **Mechanical Keyboard** (Item ID: 1151293680) - Exchange for one with clicky switches.
2. **Smart Thermostat** (Item ID: 4983901480) - Exchange for one compatible with Google Home.

The payment method for any price difference will be your existing Mastercard ending in 2478.

Please confirm if everything is correct and if you would like to proceed with the exchange.
That sounds correct! Just one question: If there's no full-size clicky keyboard with RGB backlighting available, could I get one without backlight instead?

- **Mechanical Keyboard**: Exchanged for a full-size clicky keyboard with no backlight.
- **Smart Thermostat**: Exchanged for a version compatible with Google Assistant in black.

The price difference of $16.63 will be refunded to your Mastercard ending in 2478. You will receive an email with instructions on how to return the original items.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
Thank you for your help! That's all I needed. ###STOP###

reason:
The conversation involves two main tasks: EXCHANGE_ORDER and SHOW_INFO. 

1. EXCHANGE_ORDER: The user is requesting to exchange two items from their order. The assistant follows a step-by-step process to authenticate the user, retrieve the order details, confirm the items to be exchanged, and finalize the exchange process. This task is procedural as it involves a series of actions and confirmations to complete the exchange.

2. SHOW_INFO: The user also requests information about the availability of certain product options (e.g., clicky keyboard with or without backlight). The assistant provides this information, which is a declarative task as it involves retrieving and presenting information to the user.

Overall, the conversation is both procedural and declarative because it involves executing a process (exchange) and providing information (product availability).

Sure, my email address is yusuf.rossi@example.com.

It seems I couldn't find a user with that email address. Could you please provide your first name, last name, and zip code so I can try to locate your user ID that way?
Certainly! My name is Yusuf Rossi and my zip code is 19122.

The conversation involves both procedural and declarative elements. 

Procedural: The user is actively engaging in a step-by-step process to exchange items from their order. The assistant follows the user's instructions to authenticate the user, locate the order, and process the exchange. This involves multiple steps such as verifying identity, finding the order, and selecting new items, which are procedural tasks.

Declarative: The user requests information about available options for the exchange, and the assistant provides details about the items, including item IDs and prices. The assistant also confirms the exchange and provides information about the refund process. These actions involve the assistant providing information and making decisions based on the user's requests, which are declarative tasks.

Overall, the conversation is both procedural and declarative because it involves a series of actions to complete the exchange (procedural) and the provision of information and options (declarative).

task.instruction: You are Yusuf Rossi in 19122. You want to know how many tshirt options are available in the online store right now. You want to also return the cleaner, headphone, and smart watch.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hi there! Can you tell me how many t-shirt options are available in your online store right now?
I can help you with that. First, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code?
Sure, my name is Yusuf Rossi and my zip code is 19122.

The conversation involves two main tasks: SHOW_INFO and RETURN_ORDER. 

1. SHOW_INFO: The user initially asks for information about the available T-shirt options in the online store. This task is declarative because the user is requesting information, and the assistant provides the details without requiring any procedural steps from the user.

2. RETURN_ORDER: The user wants to return items (cleaner, headphones, and smart watch). This task is procedural because it involves a series of steps that the assistant follows to process the return. The user provides confirmation and additional information as needed, and the assistant processes the return request for the headphones and smart watch. The assistant also provides instructions on how to return the items, which involves procedural actions.

Overall, the conversation is both procedural and declarative because it includes both the retrieval of information and the execution of a process.

task.instruction: You are Yusuf Rossi in 19122. You want to know how many tshirt options are available in the online store right now. You want to modify all your pending small tshirt to purple, same size, same v-neck, and prefer polyester. You are a private person that does not want to reveal much about yourself.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.

I can help you with that. First, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code?
Sure, it's Yusuf Rossi, and my zip code is 19122.

task.instruction: You are Yusuf Rossi in 19122. You want to know how many tshirt options are available in the online store right now. You want to modify all your pending tshirts to purple, s size, same v-neck, and prefer polyester. You are a private person that does not want to reveal much about yourself.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hello! I'm curious about the number of t-shirt options available in your online store right now.
I can help you with that. First, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code?
My name is Yusuf Rossi, and my zip code is 19122.

# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. - The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Need a refund.
I can help you with that. To proceed, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address?
mia.garcia2723@example.com

traj.name: find_user_id_by_email
traj.content: mia_garcia_4516
Thank you, Mia. Your identity has been authenticated. Could you please provide the order ID for which you need a refund, and let me know if the order has been delivered?
Don't have the order ID handy. Everything returned.
Since you don't have the order ID handy, I can look up your recent orders to find the relevant details. Let me retrieve your order history.

traj.name: get_user_details
traj.content: {"name": {"first_name": "Mia", "last_name": "Garcia"}, "address": {"address1": "537 Main Street", "address2": "Suite 572", "city": "Indianapolis", "country": "USA", "province": "IN", "zip": "46229"}, "email": "mia.garcia2723@example.com", "payment_methods": {"paypal_9497703": {"source": "paypal", "id": "paypal_9497703"}, "credit_card_3124723": {"source": "credit_card", "brand": "visa", "last_four": "7285", "id": "credit_card_3124723"}}, "orders": ["#W5490111", "#W7387996"]}

traj.name: get_order_details
traj.content: {"order_id": "#W5490111", "user_id": "mia_garcia_4516", "address": {"address1": "537 Main Street", "address2": "Suite 572", "city": "Indianapolis", "country": "USA", "state": "IN", "zip": "46229"}, "items": [{"name": "Water Bottle", "product_id": "8310926033", "item_id": "4579334072", "price": 54.85, "options": {"capacity": "750ml", "material": "glass", "color": "black"}}, {"name": "Mechanical Keyboard", "product_id": "1656367028", "item_id": "1421289881", "price": 268.77, "options": {"switch type": "linear", "backlight": "none", "size": "80%"}}, {"name": "Action Camera", "product_id": "3377618313", "item_id": "6117189161", "price": 481.5, "options": {"resolution": "4K", "waterproof": "yes", "color": "silver"}}, {"name": "Backpack", "product_id": "2524789262", "item_id": "4947717507", "price": 218.04, "options": {"color": "green", "size": "medium", "material": "leather", "compartment": "camera"}}], "fulfillments": [{"tracking_id": ["574297338433"], "item_ids": ["4579334072", "1421289881", "6117189161", "4947717507"]}], "status": "delivered", "payment_history": [{"transaction_type": "payment", "amount": 1023.16, "payment_method_id": "credit_card_3124723"}]}

I found your delivered order #W5490111, which includes the following items:

1. Water Bottle (750ml, glass, black) - $54.85
2. Mechanical Keyboard (linear switch, no backlight, 80%) - $268.77
3. Action Camera (4K, waterproof, silver) - $481.50
4. Backpack (green, medium, leather, camera compartment) - $218.04

The total amount paid was $1023.16 using your Visa credit card ending in 7285.

Since you mentioned that everything was returned, I can proceed with the refund. The refund will be processed to your original payment method, which is your Visa credit card, and it will take 5 to 7 business days to reflect in your account.

Please confirm if you would like to proceed with the refund.
No. Swap refund to other payment. Dislike this one.
You can choose to receive the refund to an existing gift card. Would you like to proceed with that option?
No, not a gift card. Other payment method from other order.

traj.name: get_order_details
traj.content: {"order_id": "#W7387996", "user_id": "mia_garcia_4516", "address": {"address1": "537 Main Street", "address2": "Suite 572", "city": "Indianapolis", "country": "USA", "state": "IN", "zip": "46229"}, "items": [{"name": "Gaming Mouse", "product_id": "5713490933", "item_id": "5796612084", "price": 158.89, "options": {"color": "RGB", "sensor type": "optical", "connectivity": "wired"}}], "fulfillments": [{"tracking_id": ["200246490130"], "item_ids": ["5796612084"]}], "status": "delivered", "payment_history": [{"transaction_type": "payment", "amount": 158.89, "payment_method_id": "paypal_9497703"}]}

Your other order #W7387996 was paid using PayPal. I can process the refund for order #W5490111 to your PayPal account instead.

Please confirm if you would like to proceed with the refund to your PayPal account.
Hmm... do opposite. Refund that order to Visa.
To confirm, you would like to refund order #W7387996, which was originally paid using PayPal, to your Visa credit card instead. Is that correct?
Yes, exactly that.

Unfortunately, I can only process refunds to the original payment method or an existing gift card. Since the original payment method for order #W7387996 was PayPal, I can only refund it to your PayPal account or a gift card.

If you would like to proceed with the refund to your PayPal account, please let me know.
Damn it! This is stupid! Want a human. Quickly!

function.arguments: {"summary":"User Mia Garcia wants to refund order #W7387996, originally paid with PayPal, to her Visa credit card. She is frustrated with the current options and requests to speak with a human agent for further assistance."}
function.name: transfer_to_human_agents

traj.name: transfer_to_human_agents
traj.content: Transfer successful

reason: The conversation involves multiple tasks: RETURN ORDER and MODIFY_ORDER. The user initially requests a refund, which is a RETURN ORDER task. The assistant follows a procedure to authenticate the user and retrieve order details, making this part procedural. The user then requests to change the refund method, which is a MODIFY_ORDER task. The assistant provides information about the available options and limitations, making this part declarative. Since the conversation involves both procedural steps (authentication and order retrieval) and declarative elements (providing information about refund options), it is categorized as both procedural and declarative.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hi, I'd like to cancel or return some items I purchased. I'm not really satisfied with them.
I can help you with that. First, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address? If you don't remember it, you can also provide your name and zip code.
Sure, my email is mia.garcia2723@example.com.

traj.name: find_user_id_by_email
traj.content: mia_garcia_4516

Thank you, Mia. I have successfully authenticated your identity. Now, could you please provide the order ID for the items you wish to cancel or return? This will help me check the status of your order and proceed accordingly.
I'm sorry, but I don't have the order ID with me right now.
No worries, I can help you look up your order details. Let me retrieve the information for you.

Would you like to proceed with returning the items from Order ID: #W5490111? If so, please confirm, and let me know which payment method you'd like to use for the refund.
Yes, please proceed with returning the items from Order ID: #W5490111. I’d prefer the refund through PayPal.

The refund must either go to the original payment method, which in this case is your credit card ending in 7285, or an existing gift card. Would you like to proceed with the refund to your credit card?
I'm not happy about this. Can I speak to a human agent for further assistance?

task.instruction: You are Fatima Johnson in 78712. You want to modify the pending boots to a size 8, and want the material, but do not care about waterproof or not. You are a private person that does not want to reveal much about yourself.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hi, I'd like to change the boot size for my pending order.
To assist you with changing the boot size for your pending order, I first need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address?
I'd rather not share my email. Is there another way to confirm my identity?
Sure, we can authenticate your identity using your first name, last name, and zip code. Could you please provide those details?
My name is Fatima Johnson, and my zip code is 78712.

task.instruction: You are Fatima Johnson in 78712. You want to change #W8665881 to be delivered to Suite 641 instead. You are a private person that does not want to reveal much about yourself.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hello! I need to update the delivery address for an order, please.
I can help you with that. To get started, could you please provide your email address for authentication?
I'd prefer not to share my email. Is there another way to verify my request?
That's perfectly fine. We can verify your identity using your first name, last name, and zip code. Could you please provide those details?
Sure, it's Fatima Johnson, and the zip code is 78712.

If there's anything else you need help with, feel free to let me know!

No, that's all. Thank you for your help!

The assistant follows the user's instructions to make the changes. Additionally, the conversation includes declarative elements as the assistant provides information about the current address and confirms the updated address details, which involves the assistant thinking and providing information to the user. If you can only do one of the two things, you prefer to do whatever saves you most money, but you want to know the money you can save in both ways. You are in debt and sad today, but very brief.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
I need to return a water bottle and exchange a couple of items.
I can help you with that. First, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address?
Sure, it's mei.davis@example.com.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
I won a lottery and want to upgrade some items I have. Can you help with that?

I can help you with exchanging items from a delivered order or modifying items in a pending order. To get started, I'll need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code?
