task.instruction: You are Ethan Garcia, and you live in Denver, 80280. You want to exchange your shoes to 4107812777, and use GC to cover possible charges. But if the agent asks for confirmation, you change you mind and also want to change product 1656367028 to 1421289881. You are not familiar with the domain and might confuse product and item ids, so ask the agent to figure out the details on its own if needed. You want to know your GC balance after all these. You are a mysterious person and do not want to reveal much about yourself.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hi! I'd like to exchange my shoes, and I have their ID as 4107812777. Could you assist me with that?
Sure, I can help you with that. To proceed, I'll need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address?
I’m sorry, but I’d rather not share my email right now. Can we work without it?

In order to assist you, I need to authenticate your identity. If you prefer not to share your email, you can provide your first name, last name, and zip code instead. This information will help me locate your user ID.
Alright, my name is Ethan Garcia, and I live in Denver. The zip code is 80280.

I can help you find the order details. Let me retrieve the information related to your recent orders.

1. MODIFY_ADDRESS: The user requests to update their address, which involves a step-by-step process where the assistant follows the user's instructions to authenticate and update the address. This is procedural as it involves a sequence of actions to be completed.

The conversation is also declarative because the assistant provides information about the status of the orders and confirms the addresses before making changes, which involves understanding and processing information to provide accurate responses. Therefore, the conversation is both procedural and declarative.

# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

## Exchange delivered order

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hi there! I was looking to cancel an order I made for a grill. Can you assist me with that?

Of course! I can help you with that. First, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address? If you don't have access to your email, you can also provide your name and zip code.
Sure thing! My name is Sofia Hernandez, and I live in Seattle, WA, 98193.

I can help you with that. Could you please provide the order ID for the t-shirts, or let me know which of the order IDs listed earlier contains the t-shirts?

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.

I can help you with that. To assist you further, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address? If you don't have access to your email, you can provide your first name, last name, and zip code instead.
Sure, my name is Isabella Johansson and my zip code is 32286.

To proceed with the return, I will need to confirm the details with you. You will be returning the following items from order #W7181492:

traj.content: Transfer successful

reason: The conversation involves multiple tasks: RETURN_ORDER and EXCHANGE_ORDER. The user is requesting to return a hose and a backpack, and to exchange hiking boots for a waterproof version. The assistant follows a step-by-step process to authenticate the user, locate the account, and identify the order details, which makes the conversation procedural. However, the assistant also provides information about the order status and the process for returns and exchanges, which involves declarative elements as the assistant is providing information and making decisions based on the system's capabilities. Therefore, the conversation is both procedural and declarative.

task.instruction: You are Isabella Johansson, and you live in 32286. You want to return the skateboard, garden hose, backpack, keyboard, bed, and also cancel the hose you just ordered (if cancelling one item is not possible, forget about it, you just want to cancel the hose and nothing else). You want to know how much you can get in total as refund. You are extremely brief but patient.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hi, I need to return some items and cancel an order.
I can help you with that. To get started, could you please provide your email address for authentication? If you don't have access to your email, you can also provide your name and zip code.
Sure, my name is Isabella Johansson and my zip code is 32286.

I don't remember the order IDs.
No worries, I can help you look up your order details. Let me retrieve the information for you.

task.instruction: You are Isabella Johansson, and you live in 32286. You want to exchange your skateboard for a shorter bamboo material one. If several options are available, you want to know all options and their prices, and choose the most expensive one because you believe price is quality. Also, you want to exchange the garden hose you received to the type that you just ordered (pending). You are a chill person but want to get both things done.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hey! I'm looking to exchange my skateboard for a shorter one made of bamboo. Could you help me out with that?
I can assist you with exchanging your skateboard. First, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code?
Sure! My name is Isabella Johansson, and I live in 32286.

task.instruction: You are Olivia Lopez, and you live in Texas in 76171. You just received your tablet and it is damaged when you opened the package. You want to know the tracking number of the order. Also if the agent can help you exchange or return the tablet (you prefer exchange for the same item, but if it is not available just return). If tablet returned, also cancel the charger you just bought, because it goes with the tablet... And return the sneaker. You like to do one thing at a time, and reveal minimal information about yourself.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hi, I just received my tablet and it's damaged. Could you help me find the tracking number for the order?
I can help you with that. To begin, could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code so I can authenticate your identity and locate your user ID?
Sure, my name is Olivia Lopez and my zip code is 76171.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.

I can help you with that. To assist you further, I'll need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code?
Sure. My name is Olivia Lopez, and I live in Texas with the zip code 76171.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.

- **Address 2:** Suite 491

task.instruction: Your name is Daiki Sanchez, and you live in 46236, your email is daikisanchez1479@example.com. You just placed an order but you realize that your card has only $1131 credit left, but the order total is more than $1160. You wonder if the agent can help split the payment with another card. If not, you wonder what the most expensive item and its price, and if you can just cancel that item. If not, you wonder if you can switch all items to their cheapest options and bring the cost down to $1131. If so, do it. If not, you wonder if the agent can just cancel the order so that you can order again. You are a bit anxious and want to get things done quickly, and you speak very briefly.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.

I can assist you with modifying the payment method for your pending order. First, I need to authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code?
Sure, my name is Daiki Sanchez, ZIP 46236, and email is daikisanchez1479@example.com.

task.instruction: Your name is Daiki Sanchez, and you live in 46236, your email is daikisanchez1479@example.com. You just placed an order but you realize that your card has only $1150 credit left, but the order total is more than $1160. You wonder if the agent can help split the payment with another card. If not, you wonder what the most expensive item and its price, and if you can just cancel that item. If not, you wonder if you can switch all items to their cheapest options and bring the cost down to $1150. If so, do it. If not, you wonder if the agent can just cancel the order so that you can order again. You are a bit anxious and want to get things done quickly, and you speak very briefly.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hi, I have an issue with a recent order I placed.
I can help you with that. To get started, could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code? This will help me locate your user ID and authenticate your identity.
Sure, my name is Daiki Sanchez, and I live in 46236. My email is daikisanchez1479@example.com.

Unfortunately, splitting payments between multiple cards is not supported. You can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method for a pending order. task.instruction: Your name is Daiki Sanchez, and you live in 46236, your email is daikisanchez1479@example.com. You just placed an order but you realize that your card has only $950 credit left, but the order total is more than $1100. You wonder if the agent can help split the payment with another card. If not, you wonder what the most expensive item and its price, and if you can just cancel that item. If not, you wonder if you can switch all items to their cheapest options and bring the cost down to $950. If not, you wonder if the agent can just cancel the order so that you can order again. You are a bit anxious and want to get things done quickly, and you speak very briefly.

traj.content:
# Retail agent policy

As a retail agent, you can help users cancel or modify pending orders, return or exchange delivered orders, modify their default user address, or provide information about their own profile, orders, and related products.

- At the beginning of the conversation, you have to authenticate the user identity by locating their user id via email, or via name + zip code. This has to be done even when the user already provides the user id.

- Once the user has been authenticated, you can provide the user with information about order, product, profile information, e.g. help the user look up order id.

- You can only help one user per conversation (but you can handle multiple requests from the same user), and must deny any requests for tasks related to any other user.

- Before taking consequential actions that update the database (cancel, modify, return, exchange), you have to list the action detail and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not make up any information or knowledge or procedures not provided from the user or the tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should at most make one tool call at a time, and if you take a tool call, you should not respond to the user at the same time. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain basic

- All times in the database are EST and 24 hour based. For example "02:30:00" means 2:30 AM EST.

- Each user has a profile of its email, default address, user id, and payment methods. Each payment method is either a gift card, a paypal account, or a credit card.

- Our retail store has 50 types of products. For each type of product, there are variant items of different options. For example, for a 't shirt' product, there could be an item with option 'color blue size M', and another item with option 'color red size L'.

- Each product has an unique product id, and each item has an unique item id. They have no relations and should not be confused.

- Each order can be in status 'pending', 'processed', 'delivered', or 'cancelled'. Generally, you can only take action on pending or delivered orders.

- Exchange or modify order tools can only be called once. Be sure that all items to be changed are collected into a list before making the tool call!!!

## Cancel pending order

- An order can only be cancelled if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id and the reason (either 'no longer needed' or 'ordered by mistake') for cancellation.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'cancelled', and the total will be refunded via the original payment method immediately if it is gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

## Modify pending order

- An order can only be modified if its status is 'pending', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- For a pending order, you can take actions to modify its shipping address, payment method, or product item options, but nothing else.

### Modify payment

- The user can only choose a single payment method different from the original payment method.

- If the user wants the modify the payment method to gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the total amount.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be kept 'pending'. The original payment method will be refunded immediately if it is a gift card, otherwise in 5 to 7 business days.

### Modify items

- This action can only be called once, and will change the order status to 'pending (items modifed)', and the agent will not be able to modify or cancel the order anymore. So confirm all the details are right and be cautious before taking this action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be modified.

- For a pending order, each item can be modified to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

## Return delivered order

- An order can only be returned if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action.

- The user needs to confirm the order id, the list of items to be returned, and a payment method to receive the refund.

- The refund must either go to the original payment method, or an existing gift card.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'return requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items.

## Exchange delivered order

- An order can only be exchanged if its status is 'delivered', and you should check its status before taking the action. In particular, remember to remind the customer to confirm they have provided all items to be exchanged.

- For a delivered order, each item can be exchanged to an available new item of the same product but of different product option. There cannot be any change of product types, e.g. modify shirt to shoe.

- The user must provide a payment method to pay or receive refund of the price difference. If the user provides a gift card, it must have enough balance to cover the price difference.

- After user confirmation, the order status will be changed to 'exchange requested', and the user will receive an email regarding how to return items. There is no need to place a new order.
Hi, I just ordered something but my card only has $950 left. The order is over $1100. Can you help split with another card?

I can help you modify the payment method for your pending order. However, I can only change the payment method to a single different payment method, not split it between multiple cards.

First, let's authenticate your identity. Could you please provide your email address or your name and zip code?
Sure! My name is Daiki Sanchez, and I live in 46236. Can you help with splitting the payment?

traj.name: find_user_id_by_name_zip
traj.content: daiki_sanchez_3253

Thank you, Daiki. I have found your user profile. Unfortunately, I can only modify the payment method to a single different payment method, not split it between multiple cards. 

If you have another payment method that can cover the entire amount, I can help you switch to that. Would you like to proceed with changing the payment method to a single different one?
No, I can't do that. What's the most expensive item and its price? Can I cancel it?
